Symptoms of a brain infarct caused by a cocaine overdose may include:

* Sudden weakness or numbness in the face, arm, or leg on one side of the body (stroke-like symptoms)
* Confusion or loss of consciousness (altered mental status)
* Seizures or convulsions (status epilepticus)
* Nausea and vomiting (as with acute stroke)

**Important note:** Time is critical if you suspect someone has experienced a brain infarct due to cocaine overdose!
